Bufotenine.Definition: A hallucinogenic serotonin analog found in frog or toad skins, mushrooms, higher plants, and mammals, especially in the brains, plasma, and urine of schizophrenics. Bufotenin has been used as a tool in CNS studies and misused as a psychedelic. Pharmacology: Bufotenin is a tryptamine related to the neurotransmitter serotonin. Mechanism of action: Not Available Drug type: Experimental. Illicit. Small Molecule. Drug category: Hallucinogens. Serotonin Antagonists
